alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:52PM PST until January 16 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain is the main concern within a wintry mix of snow, freezing rain, or sleet. Ice accumulations from a light glaze (0.01") to a few hundreths of an inch (0.05") are possible. Total snow accumulations of around one inch are expected, except in the Warners where amounts of up to 10 inches are possible. Winds gusting 25 to 35 mph over the mountains. * WHERE...Central and Eastern Lake County. This includes portions of Highway 395 north of Lakeview in and near Valley Falls and higher portions of Highway 140 east of Lakeview. This also includes areas across northern Lake County north of Silver Lake, including Highway 20 in far northeast Lake County. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The chance of freezing rain is expected to end between 9 and 11 PM PST tonight, before turning to to mostly snow. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
